summary: This is an internal FBI email from September 2019 discussing investigative updates regarding Ghislaine Maxwell. It mentions tracking a cell phone believed to belong to Maxwell, her location with her boyfriend Scott Borgenson in Massachusetts, and her departure following media scrutiny. The communication originates from the FBI's New York office Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking unit.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The document discusses tracking her cell phone and her recent whereabouts with her boyfriend in Massachusetts before she left due to media scrutiny.

persons.name: Scott Borgenson
persons.context: Described as Maxwell's boyfriend who lives in Manchester By the Sea, MA. The local police were in contact with him in August 2019, and Maxwell was with him before leaving.

connections.description: Described as boyfriend-girlfriend; Maxwell was staying with Borgenson in Massachusetts in August 2019.

events.title: Maxwell stays with Borgenson in Massachusetts
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was with her boyfriend Scott Borgenson in Manchester By the Sea, MA, but left after increased media scrutiny.

events.title: FBI subpoenas for Maxwell's cell phone info
events.description: The FBI is tracking a cell phone believed to belong to Ghislaine Maxwell and has just subpoenaed for subscriber information.

keyFacts: In August 2019, Ghislaine Maxwell was staying with her boyfriend Scott Borgenson in Manchester By the Sea, Massachusetts.
Maxwell left the Massachusetts location after increased media scrutiny of her activities.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking unit in New York was actively tracking a cell phone believed to belong to Maxwell as of September 2019.
The FBI had subpoenaed subscriber information for the cell phone they were tracking.
Local police in Manchester By the Sea had a good relationship with Scott Borgenson and had been in contact with him earlier in August 2019.
